Class GameLogic

java.lang.Object
GameLogic
public class GameLogic extends Object
class GameLogic contains all logic related components of the game. 1. the integer array "positions" with 24 entries which represents all possible positions where you can place a gaming piece. 2. the boolean variable "spieler1zug" which states whether it is player one's turn or not. This is in order to determine whether an entry in positions will turn to a 1(player 1) or a 2(player 2).

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors

    GameLogic()
    Constructs and initializes a game logic object with parameters positions[] and spieler1zug.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameLogic

      public GameLogic()
      Constructs and initializes a game logic object with parameters positions[] and spieler1zug. positions is initialized with 24 entries all being equals 0. spieler1zug is by default initialized with true.

  • Method Details

    • setPosition

      public void setPosition(int x)
      set method for the positions[] array. depending on the player who is to make the next move passed entry will be changed.
      Parameters:
      x - place in positions[] that is being replaced.

    • getPositions

      public int[] getPositions()
      get method for the positions[] array.
      Returns:
      array positions[] representing all fields.

    • getPositions

      public int getPositions(int x)
      get method returning a specific entry in positions.
      Parameters:
      x - entry position that is to be returned
      Returns:
      entry in position[x], being either 0, 1 or 2

      get method for the spieler1zug variable

      public boolean meinStein(int x)

      Returns:
